roleset.name: to suffer or cause to suffer from deprivation or hunger

example.name: passive
example.text: He could do more [*-1] to cut public subsidies and transfers , thus [*-1] making funds available for [public services]-1 starved [*]-1 of money for six years .

example.name: intransitive
example.text: Mr. Kaplan , author of `` [*] Surrender or Starve : The Wars Behind the Famine '' ( Westview Press , 1988 ) , lives in Lisbon .

example.name: adjectival rel: starving
example.text: `` We are starving for all the news , '' says [*T*-1] Mr. Deak , the student .

example.name: with agent
example.text: Mary starved John, trying to reduce his weight to a svelte 98 pounds.
example.arg: trying to reduce his weight to a svelte 98 pounds

roleset.note: Frames file for 'starve' based on WSJ; adjectival 'starving' based on BOLT-4,5. Member of VN class suffocate-40.7.

example.name: adjectival rel: starving
example.text: Oh and btw , a few years ago I was in a town near my home city in India with my family for qurbani - and literally the people there were starving and malnourished beyond belief .
